Ingredients:

  • 1 whole pig (around 20-30 pounds)
  • 2 cups soy sauce
  • 2 cups vinegar
  • 10 cloves garlic, minced
  • 2 tablespoons salt
  • 2 tablespoons black pepper
  • 5 stalks lemongrass, pounded
  • 10 pieces bay leaves
  • 1 cup calamansi juice or lemon juice
  • Water for basting

Instructions:

  1. Prepare the pig:
  • Make sure the pig is thoroughly cleaned, with all hair removed.
  • Score the skin of the pig all over with a sharp knife or skewer to help it become crispy during roasting.
  • Rinse the pig with water and pat it dry.
  1. Marinate the pig:
  • In a large container or basin, combine soy sauce, vinegar, minced garlic, salt, black pepper, lemongrass, bay leaves, and calamansi juice. Mix well.
  • Place the pig in the container and pour the marinade all over, making sure to get it into the cavities and scores of the pig.
  • Massage the marinade into the pig, ensuring it's evenly coated.
  • Cover the container and refrigerate overnight to marinate. You can also use a large plastic bag if it fits the pig.
  1. Prepare for roasting:
  • Preheat your oven or grill to a high temperature (around 400-450°F or 200-230°C).
  • Take the pig out of the refrigerator and let it come to room temperature for about 1-2 hours.
  1. Roasting the pig:
  • Secure the pig onto a spit or rotisserie rod, ensuring it's tightly attached and balanced.
  • Place a drip pan underneath the pig to catch the drippings.
  • Insert a meat thermometer into the thickest part of the pig, away from the bone, to monitor the internal temperature.
  • Place the pig on the grill or in the oven, making sure it rotates evenly for even cooking.
  • Cook the pig at high heat for the first 30 minutes to crisp up the skin, then reduce the temperature to medium (350-375°F or 175-190°C).
  • Baste the pig with water occasionally to keep it moist and to prevent the skin from drying out. You can use a spray bottle or a brush to apply water.
  • Continue roasting the pig until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (75°C) and the skin becomes golden brown and crispy. This will take several hours, depending on the size of the pig.
  1. Rest and serve:
  • Once the pig is cooked, carefully remove it from the rotisserie or grill and let it rest for about 30 minutes.
  • Carve the pig into serving pieces, separating the crispy skin from the meat.
  • Serve the Lechon with the crispy skin on a platter and the meat on a separate platter.
  • Enjoy the Lechon with traditional condiments such as lechon sauce, soy sauce, vinegar, or spicy vinegar.

Note:

It's important to follow food safety guidelines and ensure the pig is cooked thoroughly. The cooking time may vary depending on the size of the pig and the equipment you are using. It's recommended to use a meat thermometer to ensure the pig reaches a safe internal temperature.
